Is India's expenditure on hi-tech areas justified from the social and economic point of view. Elaborate giving reasons.
 

India is a democratic country. Every citizen residing in India has their own rights and thoughts. It is a developing country. Many new inventions and technologies have developed in India in a very short span of time. We are now living in "E" country that is E-Chat, E-mail, E-learning and many more, which have made our life easier and faster. Even the communication with other countries have become easier.

Now-a-days many expenses have been incurred on hi-tech areas which benefits every one in the society. New technologies have been introduced which is beneficial for every one.

For example -

Rail Metro - The development of Rail Metro had tremendously helped the people. Even the long hour journey has reduced to minutes, that is the distance which was covered in an hour now it has been covered in 20 minutes. Even the Rail Metro project had uplift the Economy's development, so it is justified both from economic and social point of view.

Malls - The development of Malls has also been successful and had benefited the society. People can fulfil their needs in one roof itself.

Even the development of new roads, parks, buildings, companies, schools and colleges benefits the society as well as the economy.

So, expenses incurred for any new development in Hi-tech areas will benefit the society and economy too.
